visualization module¶

Module used to provide matplotlib-based interface for spectral visualization.

class Visualization¶

Bases: object

Provides visualization functionality given spectra data.

static plot(data, y_column: str, order: int = 3, figax: Tuple[Figure, Axes] = None, **kwargs) → Figure¶

Plots spectra data with overlay of inferred continuuum

Parameters:

  • data (pandas DataFrame) – pandas DataFrame object containing spectral data for visualization. Must contain columns “loglam” and “flux”.

  • y_column (str) – column of the dataframe to plot as y.

  • figax (Tuple[matplotlib.figure.Figure ,matplotlib.axes.Axes]) – fig, ax to use if given

  • order (int, optional) – order of the polynomial used to fit the spectral data when denoising. Default is 3.

  • **kwargs (arguments to be put in the plt.plot function) –

Returns:

fig – plot of spectral data

Return type:

matplotlib.figure.Figure

Raises:

  • TypeError – Raised if data is not a pandas DataFrame object Raised if y_column is not a string

  • ValueError – Raised if data does not contain the necessary columns
